file_content.text: Phalanx says thanks for keeping his head bomb-free.
Not a bad escape. Now act normal. You never know if an Imperial's watching.
We'll question Phalanx, then change his look to help smuggle him offworld.
He should be safe until then. The Imperials rely on those cortexers so heavily their manhunting skills are a little rusty.
So is his intel useful?
Did our work pay off?
Yes. Turns out the Hutt Cartel has internal disagreements about transporting the Empire's starfighter parts.
I'm just here to help.
You've done a service. It turns out the Hutts have internal disagreements about Imperial starfighter shipments.
If we can drive a wedge between them, we can cut off starfighter air support on half a dozen planets.
We push here, and the blocks fall down somewhere else. That's how the game is played.
I should go.
Good thinking. I was about to tell you what this could mean to us, but you don't really need to know.
Just understand that the intel Phalanx found will help the war on many planets, that's for certain.
Quickly, get in there before he's prepped for surgery.
Hold your fire. Jax Dumont here, with the Stardogs. I was told you were in the area.
I'm on your side. The less said about how I got this uniform, the better.
We're getting a friend out of the Empire's prize prison, and I thought it would come in handy.
I've never heard of your organization.
Who are you again?
We're mostly former Republic soldiers--free to fight the Empire in our own way. Right now, we could use some help in an extraction.
Slow down. You're the one with an Imperial cover, not me.
What do you mean "we"?
I need your help. This outfit gets me into Shadow Town, but it won't work in the secured labs where our man is held.
His code name is Phalanx. He has vital information on Hutt dealings with the Sith.
All right. Brief me.
One of our guys, Phalanx, got himself captured to gather intel on the Imperial-Hutt connection.
He succeeded, but we weren't expecting him to be transferred here to Shadow Town. We need him out, fast.
In a few hours, Imperial surgeons will fit a cortex charge in his skull.
I could help more if I knew what a cortex charge was.
Fit a what?
A bomb in his head that detonates if he leaves prison grounds. Once it's implanted, our rescue window closes for good.
We're not sure of his number or what cell he's in. So we need you to get inside and access the main computer.
From there, find the cell and lead Phalanx out so we can hide him here. Can you do this?
Does he stand any chance of escape after one is installed?
What happens then?
Only if you know a very brave brain surgeon with experience disarming explosives.
I can do it.
It's not. We're not sure where he is in the prison. That's why I've been gathering passcodes--you or whoever breaks in will need them.
Now, you can get his location from the prison databank. I have a code that'll get you access.
Unfortunately, you'll need to be inside the prison to use it. Guards will be everywhere. Can you do this?
Your friend is safe with me.
Not a problem.
I'm Havoc Squad. The question is, what can't I do?
In my sleep.
Oh, I know prisons. I'm an escapee's best friend.
No sweat.
Okay, here's today's passcode. Get inside and use it on their main databank.
Well, if I were paid....
Oh, I see... well, it happens that this uniform's former owner wasn't exactly poor. You'll be taken care of.
Now, here's the passcode. Use it before it changes.
Open the computer, find Phalanx's cell, and bring Phalanx here to hide him. Search and rescue, am I right?
You guys got into this mess. You're getting yourselves out of it.
No. [Refuse quest.]
You're condemning Phalanx to die in there. I hope you realize that.
Nothing unusual here. Move along.
